_description: William Cornish, A complaint, perhaps of one exiled — one cross-rhymed quatrain

BodAsh176.Transcription:
Adewe adewe my hartes lustadewe my ioye & my solaswith
                    double sorowes complayne I mustvntyll I dye alas alas
BodAsh176.Editions:
Seaton,  Ethel. 
             Sir Richard Roos, c. 1410-1482: Lancastrian Poet.
         London: R. Hart-Davis, 1961: 405.

BLAdd31922.Transcription: A dew a dew my hartis lustAdew my Ioy and my solaceWyth dowbyl sorow complayn I mustvn tyl I dye alas alas
BLAdd31922.Note: Words repeated twice more with musical notes for two further singing parts.
